hall_meeting_ex_4.question: What power does the Governor have under Article 161?
options: Grant pardons for offenses against state law
answer: Grant pardons for offenses against state law

hall_meeting_ex_4.question: Who advises the Governor in performing their duties?
Who appoints the Chief Minister of a state?
options: The Speaker of the State Legislative Assembly

hall_meeting_ex_4.question: What does collective responsibility of ministers mean?
options: All ministers must work in unison with the judiciary
Ministers are responsible for decisions made in the State Legislature
Ministers are collectively accountable to the State Legislature
answer: Ministers are collectively accountable to the State Legislature

hall_meeting_ex_2.question: What does Article 73 define about the Union executive powers?
options: They are limited to matters in the Concurrent List only.
They extend to matters on which Parliament can legislate.
They can only be exercised during emergencies.
answer: They extend to matters on which Parliament can legislate.

hall_meeting_ex_2.question: What is the role of the Attorney-General of India?
options: Represents India in the United Nations
Acts as the chief legal advisor to the Government of India
answer: Acts as the chief legal advisor to the Government of India

hall_meeting_ex_2.question: Who appoints the Prime Minister of India?
What is the primary duty of the Prime Minister under Article 78?
options: To preside over all sessions of the Parliament
To communicate decisions of the Council of Ministers to the President
answer: To communicate decisions of the Council of Ministers to the President

hall_meeting_ex_1.question: Who is the head of the Indian state?
How is the President elected?
options: By the Prime Minister and Chief Ministers
